p: Coronaviruses belong to Nidovirales order; viruses depending on a nested group of mRNAs for their replication (“nido-” = “nest”). They contain the biggest known viral RNA genomes (27–32 kb in length). These viruses are enveloped positive-sense single-stranded RNA viruses. Figure 1 shows the key virus proteins. Under electron microscopy, the virus has a characteristic crown-like shape due to the presence of the spike (S) protein [ 8, 9].
